docs.title: The default config.
description: The default config; Meant for general purpose every day URL Cleaning.

flags.breezewiki: Replace fandom/known Breezewiki hosts with the `breezewiki-host` variable.
flags.nitter: Replace twitter/known Nitter hosts with the `nitter-host` variable.
flags.invidious: Replace youtube/known Invidious hosts with the `invidious-host` variabel.
flags.embed-compatibility: Sets the domain of twitter domiains (and supported twitter redirects like `vxtwitter.com`) to the variable `twitter-embed-host` and `bsky.app` to the variable `bsky-embed-host`.
flags.discord-unexternal: Replace `images-ext-1.discordapp.net` with the original images they refer to.
flags.bypass.vip: Use [bypass.vip](https://bypass.vip) to expand linkvertise and some other links.
flags.no-network: Don't make any HTTP requests. Some redirect websites will still work because they include the destination in the URL.
flags.tumblr-unsubdomain-blog: Changes `blog.tumblr.com` URLs to `tumblr.com/blog` URLs. Doesn't move `at` or `www` subdomains.
flags.youtube-unplaylist: Removes the `list` query parameter from `https://youtube.com/watch` URLs.
flags.youtube-keep-sub-confirmation: Don't remove the `sub_confirmation` query param from youtube.com URLs.
flags.remove-unused-search-query: Remove search queries from URLs that aren't search results (for example, posts).

vars.breezewiki-host: The domain to replace fandom/Breezewiki domains with when the `breezewiki` flag is enabled
vars.nitter-host: The domain to replace twitter/nitter domains with when the `nitter` flag is enabled
vars.invidious-host: The domain to replace twitter/Invidious domains with when the `invidious` flag is enabled
vars.twitter-embed-host: The domain to use for twitter when the `embed-compatibility` flag is set. Defaults to `vxtwitter.com`.
vars.bluesky-embed-host: The domain to use for bluesky when the `embed-compatibility` flag is set. Defaults to `fxbsky.com`.
vars.bypass.vip-api-key: The API key used for [bypass.vip](https://bypass.vip)'s premium backend. Overrides the `URL_CLEANER_BYPASS_VIP_API_KEY` environment variable.

environment_vars.URL_CLEANER_BYPASS_VIP_API_KEY: The API key used for [bypass.vip](https://bypass.vip)'s premium backend. Can be overridden with the `bypass.vip-api-key` variable.

sets.bypass.vip-hwwwwdpafqdnps: The `HostWithoutWWWDotPrefixAndFqdnPeriod`es of websites bypass.vip can expand.
sets.email-link-format-1-hosts: (TEMPORARY NAME) Hosts that use unknown link format 1.
sets.https-upgrade-host-blacklist: Hosts to never upgrade from `http` to `https`.
sets.redirect-hwwwwdpafqdnps: Hosts that are considered redirects in the sense that they return HTTP 3xx status codes. URLs with hosts in this set (as well as URLs with hosts that are "www." then a host in this set) will have the `ExpandRedirect` mapper applied.
sets.redirect-reg-domains: The `redirect-hwwwwdpafqdnpes` set but using the `RegDomain` of the URL.
sets.remove-empty-fragment-reg-domain-blackli: The RegDomains to not remove an empty fragment (the #stuff at the end (but specifically just a #)) from.
sets.remove-empty-query-reg-domain-blacklist: The RegDomains to not remove an empty query from.
sets.remove-www-subdomain-reg-domain-blacklis: `RegDomain`s where a `www` `Subdomain` is important and thus won't have it removed.
sets.unmobile-reg-domain-blacklist: Effectively unsets the `unmobile` flag for the specified `RegDomain`s.
sets.utps: The set of "universal tracking parameters" that are always removed for any URL with a host not in the `utp-host-whitelist` set. Please note that the `utps` common mapper in the default config also removes any parameter starting with any string in the `utp-prefixes` list and thus parameters starting with those can be omitted from this set.
sets.utps-reg-domain-whitelist: RegDomains to never remove universal tracking parameters from.

lists.utp-prefixes: If a query parameter starts with any of the strings in this list (such as `utm_`) it is removed.

maps.hwwwwdpafqdnp_lang_query_params: The name of the `HostWithoutWWWDotPrefixAndFqdnPeriod`'s language query parameter.

named_partitionings.hwwwwdpafqdnp_categories: Categories of similar websites with shared cleaning methods.

vars.SOURCE_HOST: The `Host` of the "source" of the jobs. Usually the webpage it came from.
vars.SOURCE_REG_DOMAIN: The `RegDomain` of the "source" of the jobs, Usually the webpage it came from.

vars.redirect_shortcut: For links that use redirect sites but have the final URL in the link's text/title/whatever, this is used to avoid sending that HTTP request.
vars.site_name: For furaffinity contact info links, the name of the website the contact info is for. Used for unmangling.
vars.link_text: The text of the link the job came from.
vars.bsky_handle: The handle of an `@user.bsky.social`, used to replace the `/did:plc:12345678` in the URL with the actual handle.

PartMap.comment-1: If you can't get a certain domain to work here, it may be because Mozilla's Public Suffix List, therefore the psl crate, and therefore UrlPart consideres it a suffix.
PartMap.comment-2: There's a PartMap under this one for DomainSuffix. Try it there.
